text: I’m technically on vacation a bajillion time zones away, so even if you did (rude!) nothing’s to say I’ll be popping up much over the next few days. Get all your mean subtweets out NOW!
author: bellwak

text: Guarantee everyone in Chicago will read this tweet and weep with joy or sadness because the shadow of a chance of this every happening in our city…I mean, this Gainesville deal sounds like journalist fanfic
author: bellwak

text: (Also I can’t tell you how good of a mood I’m in and coincidentally it’s my first time really looking at the TL in DAYS. No knock to the friends on here; absolute knock to the creeps on here who make Twitter the kind of place you have to take breaks from to feel healthy!)
author: bellwak

text: Also, general readers of newsletters: How do you feel about getting links that are behind full or metered paywalls? I post a lot of stuff that’s behind both, though I know that probably frustrates some folks (I want everyone to subscribe to everything but even I don’t do that)
author: bellwak

text: If you’re a current subscriber, thanks! You’ll also notice the newsletter skews politics, criminal justice and investigations heavy. Some of this is b/c that’s the bulk of so much great local reporting, but also, my biases. Would love to get more art, sports & profiles
author: bellwak

text: Chicago folks, periodic ask that I don’t make nearly enough: If you’ve written/edited (or a pub you work for) has put out a great Chicago-focused feature, always feel free to drop it my way. I want to keep the 312 newsletter I edit for @ChicagoMag fresh, inclusive & interesting
author: bellwak
